reviews.text: THIS IS NOT KARMA WATERS WRONG ADDRESS DONT SPEND MONEY GOING HERE
ngon, sạch sẽ, phục vụ nhiệt tình, thân thiện

I'd been thinking of traveling to Vietnam for a while to have a vacation as high-reward and low-stress as possible. I searched on the Internet looking for a travel company in Danang since I had planed to spend my time in this lovely city and Danang Green popped up as one of the top tour operators in the area. And my experience with Danang Green was exactly like it's supposed to be. This comprehensive expert-led company can curate itineraries based around my interests and really save my mental energy. The staffs were super friendly and very knowledgeable about every destination we came through. Even the boss was very kind and helpful. You guys are just amazing. I'm very thankful for having this great experience with Danang Green. It's worth every single penny I paid. Thank you.
I answered it, i felt very good they were very profess, i recommend that they experience their car very very, drive pro and happy even though in don't know what he said
This company provided us the good services. Many thanks. Pick up on time
Great tour company, but their English on the phone was not so good. Booking via chat was super easy and efficient.
A best travel services

Amazing temple with a view of the ocean, as seen from the standing Buddha. The temple has just more to explore than just the standing Buddha however. There’s a temple in the back, a pagoda area, and a myriad of smaller statues to admire as well.

There’s not much signal on the mountains, so be careful about relying on Grab to get a cab. I would rent a motorbike and go up yourself if possible. Bring water! It gets super hot.

Amazing place. Huge Statue some nice temples many statues and amazingly shaped small trees! I think the gardening people there deserve a big shoutout! And all of that for free, even the parking. Must go.

Stunning scenery. Completely free to walk the grounds and see beautiful statues and the pagoda. Highly recommended. Got some really beautiful photos and there is a quaint fishing area on the way. You can take a bus here, but better to take a taxi. From the beach area, it was 100,000 and the taxi waited for us and then drove us back. Great trip.

Beautiful place with a view over the beach. Impressed Buddha statue, sacred and bring peaceful mind. Prepare to be overcrowded all the time, it costs quite a ride to get here if you order Taxi. Go with COCO BUS tour. Not recommended with motorbikes for foreigners as it's on the mountain.

Temple with a really nice atmosphere. Relaxing by taking a walk in the park and in the midst of all those magnificent bonsai was beautiful. I recommend visiting during lunch time because it is less crowded with tourists.

Really nice surprise from where we were staying. Great exhibitions and informative. I have mixed feelings about museums such as these,  but ultimately they do preserve pieces of art and propel education.
Very interesting cultural exhibition. This museum is a must for anyone visiting Vietnam who is interested in ancient culture. The artefacts are well preserved and presented.

I really enjoy the sculptures and the history that comes along. The description is really helpful to understand these display. Some of the descriptions are missing, just the name. This museum is very small but lots of history in it.

We went here because it was very near and I was expecting more historical information about Vietnam. I'm sure for those more interested in sculptures and archeology it is ok. For me I found it disappointing.

Not sure how often this get puts on my most people's itinerary. If you're into sculpture and ancient civilisations, then it might be worth a visit. The Cham civilisation was a lesser known empire that dominated a region in SE Asia, particularly Cambodia and Vietnam, for a period in history. They were a very distinct culture, seperate to others in Far Asian history, with unique imagery, motifs, and mythology which often drew on Hindu traditions from India.

I honestly didn't know much about them and this museum provided a great deal of insight into their world. It found it a great primer for the Angkor temples when we got to Cambodia a week later.

My only gripe was lack air conditioning but maybe I should have checked my privilege at the door along with my reasonably price entrance fee...
Nice shop nice people nice food!
Good stuff if your into bun cha ca, don’t forget to squeeze some limes to adjust the taste!

Recommended by my friend because I like fish ball and fish cake, the soup from this shop is nice, sweet and a bit of sourly, I had tried a few Bun Cha Ca in Da Nang, but the texture of the fish cake here is the best, and they have localised menu if you ask for them. The staff is very polite and this place is clean. 

The price from this shop may not be the cheapest in Da Nang, but can still see a lot of local people enjoying their Bun Cha Ca.... you can see it is really authentic.
Mostly fish dishes! Interesting experience. Wouldn't call it my favourite vietnamese dish though
incredible place to visit: fully local, fastest service, tasty, try bun cha ca definitely here
Great food, mostly quiet. May not be ideal for long stays cause no wifi could be found
Good place for some icecream
Nice ice cream
Good.
Normal.
Cooker have a south táte, its is suitable with south person
staff is not very good. The food is not very delicious.

Both 1 & 2 shops states 9am-9pm operating hours. However, when we reached there during lunch hour. The shop was closed and the way I looked at it. The hygiene of the shop is questionable. Wasted my effort, time and money to go there.
Good food..nice staff

Horrible place, there was a fried dead fly in our tofu, food took at least half an hour and it was cold. They also don’t know how to cook half the items on their menu so then they said they can’t make it. Find another com nieu.

Delicious coffee, vegetables and steak. No complaints. I eat quite a bit of steak (from Canada) and this was still a top contender. Had the filet and it was cooked perfectly. Lots of juice and flavour. If you are in the area and want steak definitely come here. Very friendly staff also

Sat here now with the happiest Stomach...had crab cakes for starter, then salmon with lime butter sauce, roast veg and dauphinois potatoes. Everything was exquisite.  Without question the best salmon I've ever ate, great sized portion and perfectly cooked, melt in the mouth, I could eat it forever. Highly recommend this place, not the cheapest eat for Vietnam but still better than European prices and the quality of food is amazing
Ordered lamb chops and steak along with chicken. Each had its own unique taste and flavor. Food was amazing. Must go to place.

It was my second time visiting the restaurant and I’m very impressed with the quality of the steak in Vietnam. It was cooked perfectly and the sides and sauces are great as well. I also recommend the smoked salmon appetizer and the lamb ravioli was great too.

Absolutely amazing! The steak was the best I've tasted, such fresh, soft, melt in the mouth meat. The pasta was so good I thought the chef must be Italian. Highly recommended to everyone!! Chef came out to personally check how our meal was, he was so nice and you could tell he was a man who cares about the food and the people. Cheesecake dessert was beautiful too

Food is okay. But some of their plates are overpriced for the volume of food you're getting. Someone in my group ordered a beef vinegar hot pot which was actually of good value and taste. Otherwise it's relatively disappointing. Live music is nice. Service is correct.
Expensive. Staff forced us to order extra dishes using very bad attitude! Only recommend this if you want to be ripped off and treated badly.
Beautiful decoration and friendly service. Food is fresh and delicious. Live traditional music and dance along the meal. Worth trying!
Fine food, slow server
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.
The price is much higher than Vietnamese food here (like 3x-4x expensive), yet still acceptable as the food quality is excellent! You will enjoy a happy French dinner here. Recommended!

Food is good whilst price is reasonable.
The time I visited here is for celebrate my boyfriend and I sent email for reservation. However, the owner didn’t confirm me if Bday cake can be prepared even I have sent several emails before I start my trip.....

The food is great and delightful here. Even though it has a higher price than average restaurant here in Danang, but I think it’s worthy to try, and I think I will come back again in the next trip in Danang.
A traditional delicious french restaurant. My wife and I enjoy a romantic dinner here. It is highly recommended.

Good cuisine over priced , quality is good , portions are not consistent with price 
They showed special of the day ! Lobster Bisque which we order ,after few minutes they said it won't be available after 2 hours , for the level price of what they pretend to be ??? 
We pay deliver be careful with over price !

I gave it a 4 star because I expected more. It's famous because it sits on Route 66. Granted it was free and i  enjoyed the big mushrooms next to it. There is also like a Noah's ark but sits on land and it looks pretty old. About 5 miles north west off I-44 in Catoosa, Oklahoma.

I love it . . . One of my favorite stops on Route 66.  A true functional work of art that still looks great.  The nice lady who has been voluntarily working the gift shop for 8 yrs, shared the history and made me appreciate this special place even more.

If you want to experience Route 66 and it's history make this stop part of your experience. It's a brief stop but definitely worth the time. It's not everyday you get to see a whale in the middle of a landlocked state. You will get to walk inside the whale and be able to take some great photos.

This is one of those route 66 oddities. really just a strange item that is worth seeing to say you have seen it. Nothing incredibly special but the area is kept up very well and they have picnic tables and a small area to walk. Dog friendly with restrooms. Can't ask for more.

Cool, cute whale-shaped wooden dock on a pond. It didn't seem like it would be very safe for young kids, but okay for older ones. There's a ladder that goes up to a loft area with graffiti inside. There are nearby picnic tables and a small sandy area where younger kids can play.

It has grown so much since I was young..still beautiful. Lake Champlain . The only reason it was never listed as a great lake is because u can see the other side. But,it was big enough. I was born in VT. & spent many years on & off there. Lake Champlain is a place for BBQ'S, swimming & just  escaping. Having family & or friends fun.
We always love coming down here for a walk or just to play in the field with the kids. All year they have fun stuff going on usually, kids day, fourth of July with fireworks, tons of events.
The sun is shining, a breeze is blowing, and the lake is frozen over from shore to shore. It's an amazing day on the waterfront in Burlington!

This is a great place to watch the sunset. There are lots of show's during the summer,wide variety of shops, dispensary, ferry, awesome bike path, short ride to North Beach. There is a dog park, skatepark, lots of places to sit, wheelchair accessible and lots of grass to walk on, parking,boat ramps docks, playground.

Great spot on the Lake in downtown Burlington.  Convenient to parking, docks, a waterfront walking trail, Skinny Pancake crepe shop and the Leahy museum.  More than a bit cold in the winter but usually delightful in the summer and fall.  Short walk uphill to everything in downtown Burlington, a great spot to visit.

It had to happen. .. I just ate here and it was terrible. I have eaten here many times and this was by far, THE worst experience and meal. I ordered pasta and seafood in squid sauce. The meal was swimming in squid sauce. It was disgusting. All the seafood was drowning in so much squid sauce I have no idea what kind of seafood was in there.
If you have eaten here, you know they start off by bringing crispy fried onions to the table. Today it was just a lump of onion strips swimming in grease. I had a beer, the meal, and a bottle of water and it was 875 Baht. I will NEVER eat here again. Tonight was absolutely disgusting.
Really good service to go with the carefully prepared and we'll made food. We were a big group but still everything was served at the right time. The home made pasta, pizza and mains all perfect?
Perfect as usual. This place has been the best place for pizza for a least the 15 years I've been going there. Many more places have arrived but none are better

We ordered a veg pizza with tomatoes, onions , fresh chillies.... as per the menu. 
But the chef put TABASCO sauce in the pizza !!!! 

Enough said...shocking!
The best pizza I've had in Bangkok.. you can't give this a miss.. Try the Mexicana if you want vegetarian!

Delicious coffee, vegetables and steak. No complaints. I eat quite a bit of steak (from Canada) and this was still a top contender. Had the filet and it was cooked perfectly. Lots of juice and flavour. If you are in the area and want steak definitely come here. Very friendly staff also

Sat here now with the happiest Stomach...had crab cakes for starter, then salmon with lime butter sauce, roast veg and dauphinois potatoes. Everything was exquisite.  Without question the best salmon I've ever ate, great sized portion and perfectly cooked, melt in the mouth, I could eat it forever. Highly recommend this place, not the cheapest eat for Vietnam but still better than European prices and the quality of food is amazing
Ordered lamb chops and steak along with chicken. Each had its own unique taste and flavor. Food was amazing. Must go to place.

It was my second time visiting the restaurant and I’m very impressed with the quality of the steak in Vietnam. It was cooked perfectly and the sides and sauces are great as well. I also recommend the smoked salmon appetizer and the lamb ravioli was great too.

Absolutely amazing! The steak was the best I've tasted, such fresh, soft, melt in the mouth meat. The pasta was so good I thought the chef must be Italian. Highly recommended to everyone!! Chef came out to personally check how our meal was, he was so nice and you could tell he was a man who cares about the food and the people. Cheesecake dessert was beautiful too
